>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: LKW <leekw13@...>
>>To: 'sg-everquest@onelist.com' <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
>>Date: Wednesday, April 28, 1999 9:26 AM
>>Subject: [sg-everquest] Re: newbie- im
>>
>>
>>>From: LKW <leekw13@...>
>>>
>>>Nope, never heard of them, maybe Magnus (few of them in Baja). Which
shard
>>>u play?
>>>
>>>Actually Asia has approached us for alliance b4, but problem is the guild
>>>expands so fast that many noto hunters/pkers are also inside Asia now
(some
>>>of them even fight with us before when they noto hunt). It make us very
>>>uncomfortable allied with them, esp they asked for war-declared allies
(ie
>>>both side declare war, not for the sake of fighting but more for helping
>>>one another when in need). When we talked abt allies, we refer to those
>>>long-term trust-worthy ones, like our more than a yr ally - TAA. As
>>>allies, we share lots of our resources with them, eg providing free
vendor
>>>shop for them, invitation them for most guild activities etc.
>>>
>>>Problem in UO is land is so scare that there is NO WAY to put anything
>>>bigger than a small house. On the other hand, there r so many stuffs to
>>>store in UO, haha. I really look forward to see how EQ manage inventory.
>>> Any exisitng EQ players can share your experience? How many items can u
>>>carry in UO, how u keep 'stock', how to transfer stuffs amg chars of same
>>>acct etc? ;)
>>>
>>>Oh, is Innoruuk the one Gary mentioned w/o any lag? Maybe we shld set up
a
>>>Local EQ msg board for all local players to get togather discussing the
>>>game. I dun mind setting up one as my UO site already shifted to
>>>Singularity ;) Maybe 1st thing we need to discuss which server is the
best
>>>and has more locals, then new comers at least know which way they shld go
>>>;)
>>>
>>>On Tuesday, April 27, 1999 6:48 PM, Wilson [SMTP:ritzbits@...]
>>>wrote:
>>>> From: "Wilson" <ritzbits@...>
>>>>
>>>> Kudos to you. You must be good at handling people. If you come over to
>>>> Innoruuk where Gary, YinYang and I are, might stick around with you
>>>> <smiles>. Regarding the info about the game, I'd do another post.
>>>
>>>On Tuesday, April 27, 1999 6:34 PM, Wilson [SMTP:ritzbits@...]
>>>wrote:
>>>> From: "Wilson" <ritzbits@...>
>>>>
>>>> Good to know your guild are Antis, paradox/ironic to the Guild Name.
I've
>>>> heard of Asia, like you said, most HKs. Never knew the Asians are so
>>>united.
>>>> In my years of online gaming, the Asians that I meet are selfish
>>>%^&*$%@^#$.
>>>> <grins> Maybe that creates the negative image.
>>>>
>>>> Do you know Dundee? Damocles? Jeff Boy? Canticle? Magnus? Those are
great
>>>> guys. I sure do look forward to meeting them in E'ci.
>>>>
>>>> Regarding the GMs and Tower deeds etc...doesn't everyone own one?
<grins>
>>>> Sorry, my rastic humour is up again. Must be the exam stress....
>>>>
>>>> Wilson
>>>> ----- Original Message -----
>>>> From: LKW <leekw13@...>
>>>> > Hi,
>>>> >
>>>> > Not sure which UO shard you played but The Dark Wardens (tDw) is
always
>>>> the
>>>> > #2-#4 biggest veteran guild in Baja (check OSI Baja guild list).
>>> Together
>>>> > with TTW and DWN, we are always fighting for the #2 biggest. #1 in
>>>Baja
>>>> is
>>>> > Asia, which is made up of several HK/TW guilds. tDw is one pure
guild
>>>> that
>>>> > started off as local guild (formed within 2 weeks after UO launched
in
>>>> > S'pore) and slowly expanded to the the biggest single international
>>>guild
>>>> > (includes members from US, HK, Japan, S. Korea, Taiwan, Austrialia,
UK,
>>>> > etc). TWW, I think, is also one guild by itself while DWN is form by
>>>> > several groups of players to make up the player-run town called
Kingdom
>>>of
>>>> > Dawn.
>>>> >
>>>> > We are very well established in term of skills and resources (we have
>>>20
>>>> > over guild buildings, including keep, tower, 2-Ss, big brick etc, at
>>>one
>>>> > time, but reduced after the house patch is in as we do not have so
many
>>>> > mules to hold the buildings). Other than GM mage/tank mages in the
>>>guild,
>>>> > we also have several GM smiths, GM bowyers, GM alchemists, GM
scribes,
>>>GM
>>>> > bards (provokers), GM carpenters/tinkers etc. We even have GM
poisoner
>>>> > (assasin) and GM detective, hehe. As as today, I still have a castle
>>>> deed,
>>>> > a keep deed and a tower deed reserved for future guild village in
T2A,
>>>not
>>>> > to include other 2-S, big brick, big smithy house deeds ;)
>>>> >
>>>> > We also own one of the most popular shops in Baja, The Asmandi (a big
>>>> brick
>>>> > house within west britain guard zone), which have more than 3000
>>>visitors
>>>> > hits, selling only GM suberb stuffs at very reasonable price. In the
>>>shop
>>>> > we have standard price list which all vendors owners must comply
>>>(imagine
>>>> > 600gp for full AR30 plate set, all reagents at 1gp above npc shop
etc)
>>>to
>>>> > ensure the best quality stuffs sold as the most reasonable prices.
The
>>>> > shop is also well-known for it Charity Chest (a shop wreck metal
chest
>>>> > locked-down in the shop), where players can leave their unwanted
suffs
>>>so
>>>> > that newbies can find something useful from it. Pls do not think
that
>>>the
>>>> > chest is a trash bin, as newbies always find goodies inside,
including
>>>> > magical weapons ;) I myself can throw 20-30 magical stuffs inside in
>>>one
>>>> > shot. The shop also provide free usage of training/thief dummies,
>>>forge,
>>>> > anvil etc open to all players.
>>>> >
>>>> > If you play around Baja server down time, often you will see a horde
of
>>>> > black horsemen in Cov entrance, Britain X-road or Britain cemetry,
esp
>>>> Cov,
>>>> > where we rules the place most of the time. Our guild page is also
the
>>>> > hosted in Singularity Game site.
>>>> >
>>>> > Just wanna introduce tDw to more locals players ;)
>>>> >
>>>> >
>>>> > Dark Flame
>>>> > The Dark Wardens Guild Master
>>>> > http://reddawn.s-one.net.sg/uo/tdw/
>>>> >
>>>> > p/s: tDw is one of the most reputatable ANTIS guilds in Baja. No
noto
>>>> > hunting, looting, murdering, stealing is allowed in guild, offenders
>>>may
>>>> > even face severve punishment of guild KOS. No tDws will hunt any
grey
>>>> > players in the game, unless:
>>>> > - We know from past experiences that the grey chap is a baddy.
>>>> > - We see it with our own eyes that the grey chap has done something
>>>bad.
>>>> > When we said we are ANTIS, we role-played as one. ;)
>>>>
